titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Gellatly diaries 1973.298
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 14:21:12 +0000.

did.abstract: The collection consists of 2 diaries, dated 1852-1856, kept by John Gellatly of Brooklyn. Entries include short notes on the weather and his daily activities, including names of people with whom he socialized.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Gellatly was a resident of Brooklyn, New York, having emigrated to the United States aboard the ship John Hale from Greenock, Scotland in 1835.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 2 diaries, dated 1852-1856, kept by John Gellatly of Brooklyn. Entries include short notes on the weather and his daily activities, including names of people with whom he socialized.
